register.description: The Lane Control Register sets the lane specific modes of operation.

bitfield.description: The P0_ENABLE is AND'ed with the IPx_LNy_reset_n to enable the lane.
The P0_FORCE_ENABLE is OR'ed with the IPx_LNy_reset_n to force enable the lane.
The P0_ALIGN will auto align the RAW interface to 8B10B comma characters.
The P0_RAW_AUTO_START will auto sequence the RAW interface according to the configuration settings
Standard Mode
Full Rate divider for 2x MAC speed mode.
MAC clock source select: Selects which PMA clock to use as clock source for pcs_mac_clk*_ln_0 signals.
Refclk Select determines which clocks will be used for the IP refclk signal.
Oversample clock source select: Selects which PMA clock to use as clock source for pcs_ovr_clk*_ln_0.
Oversample clock divider ratio select: Selects the divider ratio for pcs_ovr_clk_divx_ln_0.
Selects which clock sources pcs_sub_clk_0.
Fclk Select determines which clocks will be used for the IP txfclk signal.
Fclk Select determines which clocks will be used for the IP rxfclk signal.

register.description: The Lane Divider Register sets the lane specific dividers of

register.description: The Lane Align reports the 8B10B alignment delay from the Comma aligner when 8B10B protocol is used in RAW mode.

register.description: PIPE common control1 register

bitfield.description: USB SuperSpeed Tx LFPS Stretch: Minimum number of data rate clock cycles in which PMA tx_lfps_en signal is asserted for USB SuperSpeed rate.
USB SuperSpeedPlus Tx LFPS Stretch: Minimum number of data rate clock cycles in which PMA tx_lfps_en signal is asserted for USB SuperSpeedPlus rate.
PCIe PIPE Gen 4 Rx mode:
TX electrical idle pre release: When this bit is set, the TX electrical idle release to the PMA is advanced 1 cycle to allow the adjustment of the data path timing
RX equalizer complete mask: When this bit is cleared, the PHY will return direction change of 0 when PMA indicates evaluation complete.
PCIe Gen 1/2 EIOS cycle error mask: When this bit is enabled and the pipe rx interface is outputting a PCIe Gen 1/2 EIOS symbol, decode errors will be masked out.
USB Gen 2 Bit Error Correction Disable: When this bit is high, bit error correction on SKP and SDS symbols is disabled.
USB PIPE3 Compatibility Mode enable: When this bit is set to 1, USB PIPE3 compatibility mode is enabled.
USB Loopback Slave Error Count disable: When this bit is set to 1, disables the error count for US loopback slave, such that the error count is not inserted into the BCNT OS.

USB Elasticity Buffer Re-align enable: When this bit is set to 1, when Rx for a USB link is initially started, the elasticity buffer is re-aligned to its idle point upon seeing 3 consecutive COMMAs (i.e. from TS1/TS2s) in the same relative bit position.
PHY APB access timeout: When set, an APB read/write request to PHY registers failed (i.e. timed out).
Comma realign: This field controls the comma alignment state machine to re-align to new bit position without going to loss of sync state for Gen1/2.
Block alignment clear on EIOS Gen4: When this bit is enabled and the Gen 3/4 block alignment sees an EIOS, then the block alignment will automatically reset regardless of signal detect from the PMA.
Comma alignment clear on EIOS Gen2: When this bit is enabled and the Gen 1/2 comma alignment sees an EIOS, then the COMMA alignment will automatically reset regardless of signal detect from the PMA.
Block alignment ignore rx_sigdetect Gen4: When this signal is enabled, the PCS receive path block alignment will not clear due to loss of signal detection from the PMA in Gen 3/4 mode.
Comma alignment ignore rx_sigdetect Gen2: When this signal is enabled, the PCS receive path COMMA alignment will not clear due to loss of signal detection from the PMA in Gen 1/2 mode.
RX signal detect delay: Controls how much delay to add to the PMA signal detect to delay when the bit alignment blocks should be reset after losing signal.

register.description: PIPE comma lock configuration1 register ()

bitfield.description: comma lock count fast: The number of COMMA symbols that needs to be seen in the same bit position for the comma state machine to lock for Gen1/2.
comma lock count: The number of COMMA symbols that needs to be seen in the same bit position for the comma state machine to lock for Gen1/2.
Symbol unlock count: The number of COMMA symbols that needs to be seen in the wrong bit position before the comma alignment state machine will transition to RESYNC or LOS state for Gen1/2.
comma full lock count: The number of COMMA symbols that needs to be seen in the same bit position for the comma alignment state machine to lock for Gen1/2.

register.description: PIPE EIEOS lock configuration register ()

bitfield.description: lane disable: When set the appropriate lane is disabled.
EIE lock count fast: The number of EIEOS blocks that need to be seen in the same bit position for the alignment state machine to lock for Gen3/4.
EIE lock count: The number of EIEOS blocks that need to be seen in the same bit position for the alignment state machine to lock for Gen3/4.
EIE full lock count: The number of EIEOS blocks that need to be seen in the same bit position for the alignment state machine to lock for Gen3/4.

register.description: PHY interrupt status register Offset = D024h + (j * 200h); where j = 0h to 1h

bitfield.description: State change monitor enable -
Next power state/data rate - Only valid when one of the interrupt status bits is set.
Current power state/data rate - Only valid when one of the interrupt status bits is set.
Data rate state change interrupt status - Set to 1 upon data rate change timeout.
Power state change interrupt status - Set to 1 upon power state change timeout.

register.description: PHY PIPE lane margining control and status register (#) Offset = D030h + (j * 200h); where j = 0h to 1h

bitfield.description: When in PHY isolation mode, this field provides the data for the 2nd cycle of a MAC-to-PHY register interface operation (for operations that require 2 or more cycle).
When in PHY isolation mode, this field provides the data for the 1st cycle of a MAC-to-PHY register interface operation.
Error count saturated flag: When set to 1, the error counter for the associated lane has saturated.
Sample count saturated flag: When set to 1, the sample counter for the associated lane has saturated.
Committed write invalid address error: When set to 1, an invalid register address was received on the PIPE MAC-to-PHY register interface for a committed write operation for the associated lane.
Uncommitted write invalid address error: When set to 1, an invalid register address was received on the PIPE MAC-to-PHY register interface for an uncommitted write operation for the associated lane.
Lane margining enable:
Lane margining controller soft reset: Soft reset to the associated lane's lane margining controller block (i.e.
Lane margining PMA I/F soft reset: Soft reset to the associated lane's lane margining PMA interface block (i.e. MAC-XPHY).
Lane margining PIPE Tx I/F soft reset: Soft reset to the associated lane's lane margining PIPE transmit block (i.e. MAC-XPHY).
Lane margining PIPE Rx I/F soft reset: Soft reset to the associated lane's lane margining PIPE receive block (i.e. MAC-XPHY).
Lane margining soft reset: Soft reset to the associated lane's lane margining logic.

register.description: PHY PIPE lane margining MAC-to-PHY isolation register 1 (#) Offset = D034h + (j * 200h); where j = 0h to 1h

bitfield.description: Captures the data from a PHY-to-MAC write (committed or uncommitted) operation to address 1.
Captures the data from a PHY-to-MAC write (committed or uncommitted) operation to address 0.
When in PHY isolation mode, write a 1 to this bit to initiate a MAC-to-PHY register interface operation.
When in PHY isolation mode, this field provides the data for the 3rd cycle of a MAC-to-PHY register interface operation.

register.description: PHY PIPE lane margining PHY-to-MAC isolation register 1 (#) Offset = D038h + (j * 200h); where j = 0h to 1h

Captures the data from a PHY-to-MAC write (committed or uncommitted) operation to address 2.

register.description: PHY PIPE lane margining PHY-to-MAC status isolation register 1 (#) Offset = D03Ch + (j * 200h); where j = 0h to 1h

bitfield.description: Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC read completion.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC write acknowledgment.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC committed write to an unsupported address.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC committed write to address 2.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC committed write to address 1.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC committed write to address 0.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC uncommitted write to an unsupported address.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC uncommitted write to address 2.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC uncommitted write to address 1.
Set upon receiving a PHY-to-MAC uncommitted write to address 0.
